alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Cross; Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:53AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Poinsett, northwestern Crittenden and northern Cross Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 753 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cherry Valley, or 9 miles southwest of Harrisburg, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Earle, Parkin, Tyronza, Cherry Valley, Crawfordsville, Gilmore, Turrell, Three Forks, Wiley Crossing, Birdeye, Deckerville, Supply, Weona Junction, Stewart, Colton, Twist, Mersman, Cloar, Bay Village and Coldwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
